title: Make me a business card? Medical Spa/letterpress
content:
I read through the posting guidelines, and do not think I’m going against the rules. If I am, I sincerely apologize.

Basically, I was hoping one of you typophile gurus would be interested in taking on a business card design project.

As stated, it is for a medical spa, so I need it to convey both professionalism and some refinement/luxury. I was thinking letterpress would add to the latter, but am open to discussions.

I prefer something clean and relatively sparse, but again am open to ideas.

More details can be provided as needed. I hope one of you has the time and the interest!

we can also discuss payment options.

I’m looking for this to be done sooner rather than later.

hope to hear from you!

pc

 [‹ Type and social responsibility](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830100749/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39040 "Go to previous forum topic") [Looking for a FontLab manual ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830100749/http:/www.typophile.com/node/18228 "Go to next forum topic")
author: pcman

comments.content: You should add that you are based in Chicago, as this community is quite international.

sorry, you’re right — although truth be told, I would be happy to work with someone over the internet wherever they are!

thanks.

Not sure if you’ve already found a letterpresser to work with, but I’m with a small company in Atlanta, Georgia - Legacy Letterpress - and would be happy to speak with you about business cards. We’re on the web at [www.legacyletterpress.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830100749/http:/www.legacyletterpress.com/ "www.legacyletterpress.com"). Let me know if you’re interested!

Emily
